parameters.name: role
parameters.description: ARIA role describing the function of the list. listbox and menu are a common values.

parameters.name: item_classes
parameters.description: Additional CSS classes to attach to items.

parameters.name: scheme
parameters.description: One of `:full` or `:inset`.. `inset` children are offset (vertically and horizontally) from list edges. `full` (default) children are flush (vertically and horizontally) with list edges.

parameters.name: show_dividers
parameters.description: Display a divider above each item in the list when it does not follow a header or divider.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: scheme
parameters.description: Display a background color if scheme is `filled`.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the sub list the heading belongs to. Used internally.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Sub list title.

parameters.name: subtitle
parameters.description: Optional sub list description.

parameters.name: scheme
parameters.description: Display a background color if scheme is `filled`.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Semantic tag for the heading.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: list
parameters.description: The list that contains this item. Used internally.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: This item's parent item. `nil` if this item is at the root. Used internally.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Item label.

parameters.name: label_classes
parameters.description: CSS classes that will be added to the label.

parameters.name: content_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments) used to construct the item's anchor or button tag.

parameters.name: truncate_label
parameters.description: Truncate label with ellipsis.

parameters.name: href
parameters.description: Link URL.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: ARIA role describing the function of the item.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Controls block sizing of the item.

parameters.name: scheme
parameters.description: Controls color/style based on behavior.

parameters.name: disabled
parameters.description: Disabled items are not clickable and visually dim.

parameters.name: description_scheme
parameters.description: Display description inline with label, or block on the next line.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Sets an active state on navigational items.

parameters.name: on_click
parameters.description: JavaScript to execute when the item is clicked.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Used internally.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: label_text
parameters.description: The label of the input.

parameters.name: src
parameters.description: The route to query.

parameters.name: input_id
parameters.description: Id of the input element.

parameters.name: input_name
parameters.description: Optional name of the input element, defaults to `input_id` when not set.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: Id of the list element.

parameters.name: with_icon
parameters.description: Controls if a search icon is visible, defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: is_label_visible
parameters.description: Controls if the label is visible. If `false`, screen reader only text will be added.

parameters.name: is_clearable
parameters.description: Adds optional clear button.

parameters.name: is_label_inline
parameters.description: Controls if the label is inline. On smaller screens, label will always become stacked.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Value of the item.

parameters.name: selected
parameters.description: Whether the item is selected.

parameters.name: disabled
parameters.description: Whether the item is disabled.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: full
parameters.description: Whether the component should take up the full width of the screen.

parameters.name: full_when_narrow
parameters.description: Whether the component should take up the full width of the screen when rendered inside smaller viewports.

parameters.name: dismissible
parameters.description: Whether the component can be dismissed with an "x" button.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Description text rendered underneath the message.

parameters.name: icon
parameters.description: The name of an [Octicon](https://primer.style/octicons/) icon to use. If no icon is provided, a default one will be chosen based on the scheme.

parameters.name: scheme
parameters.description: One of `:danger`, `:default`, `:success`, or `:warning`.

parameters.name: reappear
parameters.description: Whether or not the flash banner should reappear after being dismissed. Only for use in test and preview environments.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: scheme
parameters.description: One of `:default`, `:outline`, `:primary`, or `:transparent`.

parameters.name: variant
parameters.description: One of `:default` or `:large`.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: One of `:a` or `:button`.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: One of `:button` or `:submit`.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Value for the HTML name attribute.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Value for the HTML id attribute.

parameters.name: class
parameters.description: CSS classes to include in the input's HTML `class` attribute. Exists for compatibility with Rails form builders.

parameters.name: classes
parameters.description: CSS classes to include in the input's HTML `class` attribute. Combined with the `:class` argument. The list may contain strings, hashes, or `nil` values, and is automatically cleaned up by Primer's [`class_name` helper](https://github.com/primer/view_components/blob/c9cb95c98fee3e2e27f4a10683f555e22285e7f1/app/lib/primer/class_name_helper.rb) (`nils`, falsy entries, and blank strings are ignored).

parameters.name: caption
parameters.description: A string describing the field and what sorts of input it expects. Displayed below the input.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Label text displayed above the input.

parameters.name: visually_hide_label
parameters.description: When set to `true`, hides the label. Although the label will be hidden visually, it will still be visible to screen readers.

parameters.name: disabled
parameters.description: When set to `true`, the input will not accept keyboard or mouse input.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: When set to `true`, visually hides the field.

parameters.name: invalid
parameters.description: If set to `true`, the input will be rendered with a red border. Implied if `validation_message` is truthy. This option is set to `true` automatically if the model object associated with the form reports that the input is invalid via Rails validations. It is provided for cases where the form does not have an associated model. If the input is invalid as determined by Rails validations, setting `invalid` to `false` will have no effect.

parameters.name: validation_message
parameters.description: A string displayed between the caption and the input indicating the input's contents are invalid. This option is, by default, set to the first Rails validation message for the input (assuming the form is associated with a model object). Use `validation_message` to override the default or to provide a validation message in case there is no associated model object.

parameters.name: label_arguments
parameters.description: Attributes that will be passed to Rails' `builder.label` method. These can be HTML attributes or any of the other label options Rails supports. They will appear as HTML attributes on the `<label>` tag.

parameters.name: scope_name_to_model
parameters.description: Default `true`. When set to `false`, prevents the model name from prefixing the field name. For example, if the field name is `my_field`, Rails will normally emit an HTML name attribute of `model[my_field]`. Setting `scope_name_to_model` to `false` will cause Rails to emit `my_field` instead.

parameters.name: scope_id_to_model
parameters.description: Default `true`. When set to `false`, prevents the model name from prefixing the field ID. For example, if the field name is `my_field`, Rails will normally emit an HTML ID attribute of `model_my_field`. Setting `scope_id_to_model` to `false` will cause Rails to emit `my_field` instead.

parameters.name: required
parameters.description: Default `false`. When set to `true`, causes an asterisk (*) to appear next to the field's label indicating it is a required field. Note that this option explicitly does _not_ add a `required` HTML attribute. Doing so would enable native browser validations, which are inaccessible and inconsistent with the Primer design system.

parameters.name: aria
parameters.description: Key/value pairs that represent Aria attributes and their values. Eg. `aria: { current: true }` becomes `aria-current="true"`.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Key/value pairs that represent data attributes and their values. Eg. `data: { foo: "bar" }` becomes `data-foo="bar"`.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: A hash of attributes passed to the underlying Rails builder methods. These options may mean something special depending on the type of input, otherwise they are emitted as HTML attributes. See the [Rails documentation](https://guides.rubyonrails.org/form_helpers.html) for more information. In addition, the usual Primer utility arguments are accepted in system arguments. For example, passing `mt: 2` will add the `mt-2` class to the input. See the Primer system arguments docs for details.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Value for the HTML name attribute.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: On form submission, this value will be sent to the server if the check box is checked. Defaults to "1".

parameters.name: unchecked_value
parameters.description: On form submission, this value will be sent to the server if the check box is _not_ checked. Defaults to "0".

parameters.name: scheme
parameters.description: Controls how check box values are submitted to the server. One of `:array` or `:boolean`..

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Value for the HTML name attribute. When provided, the check box values will be submitted in to the server in `:array` mode. See the [CheckBox](/components/alpha/checkbox) for more information.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Label text displayed above the input.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: When set to `true`, visually hides the group.

parameters.name: caption
parameters.description: A string describing the field and what sorts of input it expects. Displayed below the group.

parameters.name: label_arguments
parameters.description: Attributes that will be passed to Rails' `builder.label` method. These can be HTML attributes or any of the other label options Rails supports. They will appear as HTML attributes on the `<label>` tag.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the dialog.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Describes the content of the dialog.

parameters.name: subtitle
parameters.description: Provides additional context for the dialog, also setting the `aria-describedby` attribute.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the dialog. One of `:auto`, `:large`, `:medium`, `:medium_portrait`, `:small`, or `:xlarge`.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position of the dialog. One of `:center`, `:left`, or `:right`.

parameters.name: position_narrow
parameters.description: The position of the dialog when narrow. One of `:bottom`, `:fullscreen`, `:inherit`, `:left`, or `:right`.

parameters.name: visually_hide_title
parameters.description: If true will hide the heading title, while still making it available to Screen Readers.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: show_divider
parameters.description: Show a divider between the footer and body.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Describes the content of the dialog.

parameters.name: subtitle
parameters.description: Provides dditional context for the dialog, also setting the `aria-describedby` attribute.

parameters.name: show_divider
parameters.description: Show a divider between the header and body.

parameters.name: visually_hide_title
parameters.description: Visually hide the `title` while maintaining a label for assistive technologies.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: overlay
parameters.description: One of `:dark`, `:default`, or `:none`.

parameters.name: with_caret
parameters.description: Whether or not a caret should be rendered in the button.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: as
parameters.description: When `as` is `:list`, wraps the menu in a `<ul>` with a `<li>` for each item.

parameters.name: header
parameters.description: Header to be displayed above the menu.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Value for the HTML name attribute.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Value for the HTML id attribute.

parameters.name: class
parameters.description: CSS classes to include in the input's HTML `class` attribute. Exists for compatibility with Rails form builders.

parameters.name: classes
parameters.description: CSS classes to include in the input's HTML `class` attribute. Combined with the `:class` argument. The list may contain strings, hashes, or `nil` values, and is automatically cleaned up by Primer's [`class_name` helper](https://github.com/primer/view_components/blob/c9cb95c98fee3e2e27f4a10683f555e22285e7f1/app/lib/primer/class_name_helper.rb) (`nils`, falsy entries, and blank strings are ignored).

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Label text displayed above the input.

parameters.name: aria
parameters.description: Key/value pairs that represent Aria attributes and their values. Eg. `aria: { current: true }` becomes `aria-current="true"`.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Key/value pairs that represent data attributes and their values. Eg. `data: { foo: "bar" }` becomes `data-foo="bar"`.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: A hash of attributes passed to the underlying Rails builder methods. These options may mean something special depending on the type of input, otherwise they are emitted as HTML attributes. See the [Rails documentation](https://guides.rubyonrails.org/form_helpers.html) for more information. In addition, the usual Primer utility arguments are accepted in system arguments. For example, passing `mt: 2` will add the `mt-2` class to the input. See the Primer system arguments docs for details.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Label text displayed above the input.

parameters.name: caption
parameters.description: Describes the field and what sort of input it expects. Displayed below the input. Note that the `caption` slot is also available and takes precedence over this argument when provided.

parameters.name: validation_message
parameters.description: A string displayed in red between the caption and the input indicating the input's contents are invalid.

parameters.name: required
parameters.description: Default `false`. When set to `true`, causes an asterisk (*) to appear next to the field's label indicating it is a required field. Note that this option explicitly does _not_ add a `required` HTML attribute. Doing so would enable native browser validations, which are inaccessible and inconsistent with the Primer design system.

parameters.name: visually_hide_label
parameters.description: When set to `true`, hides the label. Although the label will be hidden visually, it will still be visible to screen readers.

parameters.name: full_width
parameters.description: When set to `true`, the form control will take up all the horizontal space allowed by its container.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: inline
parameters.description: Whether or not the button is inline.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: inline
parameters.description: Whether or not the expander is inline.

parameters.name: button_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments) for the button element.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: src
parameters.description: The source url of the image.

parameters.name: alt
parameters.description: Specifies an alternate text for the image.

parameters.name: lazy
parameters.description: Whether or not to lazily load the image.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: src
parameters.description: The path of the image to crop.

parameters.name: rounded
parameters.description: If the crop mask should be a circle. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: stacking_breakpoint
parameters.description: When the `Layout` should change from rows into columns. One of `:lg`, `:md`, or `:sm`.

parameters.name: first_in_source
parameters.description: Which element to render first in the HTML. This will change the keyboard navigation order. One of `:main` or `:sidebar`.

parameters.name: gutter
parameters.description: The amount of space between the main section and the sidebar. One of `:condensed`, `:default`, `:none`, or `:spacious`.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: One of `:full`, `:lg`, `:md`, or `:xl`.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.description: Value for the HTML name attribute.

parameters.name: selected_item_id
parameters.description: The ID of the currently selected item. The default is `nil`, meaning no item is selected.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: selected_item_id
parameters.description: The ID of the currently selected list item. Used internally.

parameters.name: selected_by_ids
parameters.description: The list of IDs that select this item. In other words, if the `selected_item_id` attribute on the parent `NavList` is set to one of these IDs, the item will appear selected.

parameters.name: expanded
parameters.description: Whether this item shows (expands) or hides (collapses) its list of sub items.

parameters.name: sub_item
parameters.description: Whether or not this item is nested under a parent item. Used internally.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: selected_item_id
parameters.description: The ID of the currently selected item. Used internally.

parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: invalid
parameters.description: If set to `true`, the input will be rendered with a red border. Implied if `validation_message` is truthy. This option is set to `true` automatically if the model object associated with the form reports that the input is invalid via Rails validations. It is provided for cases where the form does not have an associated model. If the input is invalid as determined by Rails validations, setting `invalid` to `false` will have no effect.

parameters.name: validation_message
parameters.description: A string displayed between the caption and the input indicating the input's contents are invalid. This option is, by default, set to the first Rails validation message for the input (assuming the form is associated with a model object). Use `validation_message` to override the default or to provide a validation message in case there is no associated model object.

parameters.name: label_arguments
parameters.description: Attributes that will be passed to Rails' `builder.label` method. These can be HTML attributes or any of the other label options Rails supports. They will appear as HTML attributes on the `<label>` tag.

parameters.name: scope_name_to_model
parameters.description: Default `true`. When set to `false`, prevents the model name from prefixing the field name. For example, if the field name is `my_field`, Rails will normally emit an HTML name attribute of `model[my_field]`. Setting `scope_name_to_model` to `false` will cause Rails to emit `my_field` instead.

parameters.name: scope_id_to_model
parameters.description: Default `true`. When set to `false`, prevents the model name from prefixing the field ID. For example, if the field name is `my_field`, Rails will normally emit an HTML ID attribute of `model_my_field`. Setting `scope_id_to_model` to `false` will cause Rails to emit `my_field` instead.

parameters.name: required
parameters.description: Default `false`. When set to `true`, causes an asterisk (*) to appear next to the field's label indicating it is a required field. Note that this option explicitly does _not_ add a `required` HTML attribute. Doing so would enable native browser validations, which are inaccessible and inconsistent with the Primer design system.

parameters.name: aria
parameters.description: Key/value pairs that represent Aria attributes and their values. Eg. `aria: { current: true }` becomes `aria-current="true"`.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Key/value pairs that represent data attributes and their values. Eg. `data: { foo: "bar" }` becomes `data-foo="bar"`.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: A hash of attributes passed to the underlying Rails builder methods. These options may mean something special depending on the type of input, otherwise they are emitted as HTML attributes. See the [Rails documentation](https://guides.rubyonrails.org/form_helpers.html) for more information. In addition, the usual Primer utility arguments are accepted in system arguments. For example, passing `mt: 2` will add the `mt-2` class to the input. See the Primer system arguments docs for details.

parameters.name: multiple
parameters.description: If set to true, the selection will allow multiple choices.

parameters.name: include_blank
parameters.description: If set to true, an empty option will be created. If set to a string, the string will be used as the option's content and the value will be empty.

parameters.name: prompt
parameters.description: Create a prompt option with blank value and the text asking user to select something.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Value for the HTML name attribute.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Value for the HTML id attribute.

parameters.name: class
parameters.description: CSS classes to include in the input's HTML `class` attribute. Exists for compatibility with Rails form builders.

parameters.name: classes
parameters.description: CSS classes to include in the input's HTML `class` attribute. Combined with the `:class` argument. The list may contain strings, hashes, or `nil` values, and is automatically cleaned up by Primer's [`class_name` helper](https://github.com/primer/view_components/blob/c9cb95c98fee3e2e27f4a10683f555e22285e7f1/app/lib/primer/class_name_helper.rb) (`nils`, falsy entries, and blank strings are ignored).

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Label text displayed above the input.

parameters.name: aria
parameters.description: Key/value pairs that represent Aria attributes and their values. Eg. `aria: { current: true }` becomes `aria-current="true"`.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Key/value pairs that represent data attributes and their values. Eg. `data: { foo: "bar" }` becomes `data-foo="bar"`.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: A hash of attributes passed to the underlying Rails builder methods. These options may mean something special depending on the type of input, otherwise they are emitted as HTML attributes. See the [Rails documentation](https://guides.rubyonrails.org/form_helpers.html) for more information. In addition, the usual Primer utility arguments are accepted in system arguments. For example, passing `mt: 2` will add the `mt-2` class to the input. See the Primer system arguments docs for details.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: One of `:div` or `:nav`.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Sets an `aria-label` that helps assistive technology users understand the purpose of the links, and distinguish it from similar elements.

parameters.name: body_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments) for the body wrapper.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Sets an `aria-label` that helps assistive technology users understand the purpose of the tabs.

parameters.name: align
parameters.description: One of `:left` or `:right`. - Defaults to left

parameters.name: body_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments) for the body wrapper.

parameters.name: wrapper_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments) for the `TabContainer` wrapper.

parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: full_width
parameters.description: When set to `true`, the field will take up all the horizontal space allowed by its container.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Value for the HTML name attribute.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Value for the HTML id attribute.

parameters.name: class
parameters.description: CSS classes to include in the input's HTML `class` attribute. Exists for compatibility with Rails form builders.

parameters.name: classes
parameters.description: CSS classes to include in the input's HTML `class` attribute. Combined with the `:class` argument. The list may contain strings, hashes, or `nil` values, and is automatically cleaned up by Primer's [`class_name` helper](https://github.com/primer/view_components/blob/c9cb95c98fee3e2e27f4a10683f555e22285e7f1/app/lib/primer/class_name_helper.rb) (`nils`, falsy entries, and blank strings are ignored).

parameters.name: caption
parameters.description: A string describing the field and what sorts of input it expects. Displayed below the input.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Label text displayed above the input.

parameters.name: visually_hide_label
parameters.description: When set to `true`, hides the label. Although the label will be hidden visually, it will still be visible to screen readers.

parameters.name: disabled
parameters.description: When set to `true`, the input will not accept keyboard or mouse input.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: When set to `true`, visually hides the field.

parameters.name: invalid
parameters.description: If set to `true`, the input will be rendered with a red border. Implied if `validation_message` is truthy. This option is set to `true` automatically if the model object associated with the form reports that the input is invalid via Rails validations. It is provided for cases where the form does not have an associated model. If the input is invalid as determined by Rails validations, setting `invalid` to `false` will have no effect.

parameters.name: validation_message
parameters.description: A string displayed between the caption and the input indicating the input's contents are invalid. This option is, by default, set to the first Rails validation message for the input (assuming the form is associated with a model object). Use `validation_message` to override the default or to provide a validation message in case there is no associated model object.

parameters.description: Default `true`. When set to `false`, prevents the model name from prefixing the field name. For example, if the field name is `my_field`, Rails will normally emit an HTML name attribute of `model[my_field]`. Setting `scope_name_to_model` to `false` will cause Rails to emit `my_field` instead.

parameters.name: scope_id_to_model
parameters.description: Default `true`. When set to `false`, prevents the model name from prefixing the field ID. For example, if the field name is `my_field`, Rails will normally emit an HTML ID attribute of `model_my_field`. Setting `scope_id_to_model` to `false` will cause Rails to emit `my_field` instead.

Note that this option explicitly does _not_ add a `required` HTML attribute. Doing so would enable native browser validations, which are inaccessible and inconsistent with the Primer design system.

For example, passing `mt: 2` will add the `mt-2` class to the input. See the Primer system arguments docs for details.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size of the field. One of `:large`, `:medium`, or `:small`.

Setting `scope_name_to_model` to `false` will cause Rails to emit `my_field` instead.

For example, if the field name is `my_field`, Rails will normally emit an HTML ID attribute of `model_my_field`. Setting `scope_id_to_model` to `false` will cause Rails to emit `my_field` instead.

Note that this option explicitly does _not_ add a `required` HTML attribute. Doing so would enable native browser validations, which are inaccessible and inconsistent with the Primer design system.

parameters.name: aria
parameters.description: Key/value pairs that represent Aria attributes and their values. Eg. `aria: { current: true }` becomes `aria-current="true"`.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Key/value pairs that represent data attributes and their values. Eg. `data: { foo: "bar" }` becomes `data-foo="bar"`.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: A hash of attributes passed to the underlying Rails builder methods. These options may mean something special depending on the type of input, otherwise they are emitted as HTML attributes. See the [Rails documentation](https://guides.rubyonrails.org/form_helpers.html) for more information. In addition, the usual Primer utility arguments are accepted in system arguments. For example, passing `mt: 2` will add the `mt-2` class to the input. See the Primer system arguments docs for details.

parameters.name: placeholder
parameters.description: Placeholder text.

parameters.name: inset
parameters.description: If `true`, renders the input in a visually inset state.

parameters.name: monospace
parameters.description: If `true`, uses a monospace font for the input field.

parameters.name: auto_check_src
parameters.description: When provided, makes a request to the given URL whenever the contents of the text field changes. If the server responds with a non-2xx status code, the response body is used as the validation message.

parameters.name: leading_visual
parameters.description: Renders a leading visual icon before the text field's cursor. The hash will be passed to Primer's [Octicon](/components/beta/octicon) component.

parameters.name: show_clear_button
parameters.description: Whether or not to include a clear button inside the input that clears the input's contents when clicked.

parameters.name: clear_button_id
parameters.description: The HTML id attribute of the clear button.

parameters.name: src
parameters.description: The URL to POST to when the toggle switch is toggled. If `nil`, the toggle switch will not make any requests.

parameters.name: csrf_token
parameters.description: A CSRF token that will be sent to the server as "authenticity_token" when the toggle switch is toggled. Unused if `src` is `nil`.

parameters.name: checked
parameters.description: Whether the toggle switch is on or off.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Whether or not the toggle switch responds to user input.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: What size toggle switch to render. One of `:end` or `:start`.

parameters.name: status_label_position
parameters.description: Which side of the toggle switch to render the status label. One of `:medium` or `:small`.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: for_id
parameters.description: The ID of the element that the tooltip should be attached to.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: One of `:description` or `:label`.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text content of the tooltip. This should be brief and no longer than a sentence.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.description: One of `:div` or `:nav`.

parameters.description: Controls if the label is visible. If `true`, screen reader only text will be added.

parameters.description: Adds optional clear button.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Input size can be small, medium (default), or large

parameters.name: full_width
parameters.description: Input can be full-width or fit to content

parameters.name: disabled
parameters.description: Disabled input

parameters.name: invalid
parameters.description: Invalid input

parameters.description: The placeholder text displayed within the input

parameters.name: inset
parameters.description: subtle input background color

parameters.name: monospace
parameters.description: monospace input font family

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Value of the item.

parameters.name: selected
parameters.description: Whether the item is selected.

parameters.name: disabled
parameters.description: Whether the item is disabled.

parameters.name: description_variant
parameters.description: Changes the description style. Allowed values are :inline, :block

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Display description text below label

parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: src
parameters.description: The source url of the avatar image.

parameters.name: alt
parameters.description: Passed through to alt on img tag.

parameters.name: shape
parameters.description: Shape of the avatar. One of `:circle` or `:square`.

parameters.name: href
parameters.description: The URL to link to. If used, component will be wrapped by an `<a>` tag.

parameters.name: tooltipped
parameters.description: Whether to add a tooltip to the stack or not.

parameters.name: body_arguments
parameters.description: Parameters to add to the Body. If `tooltipped` is set, has the same arguments as [Tooltip](/components/tooltip). The default tag is `:div` but can be changed using `tag:` to one of `:div` or `:span`.

parameters.name: block
parameters.description: Whether button is full-width with `display: block`.

parameters.description: Adds a maximum width of `485px` to the Blankslate.

parameters.name: spacious
parameters.description: Increases the padding from `32px` to `80px 40px`.

parameters.name: border
parameters.description: Adds a border around the Blankslate.

parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.description: One of `:condensed`, `:default`, or `:spacious`.

parameters.name: aria-label
parameters.description: String that will be read to screenreaders when the component is focused

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Text to copy into the users clipboard when they click the component.

parameters.name: for
parameters.description: Element id from where to get the copied value.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: One of `:button` or `:submit`.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number to be displayed (e.x. # of issues, pull requests)

parameters.name: scheme
parameters.description: Color scheme. One of `:default`, `:primary`, or `:secondary`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum value to display. Pass `nil` for no limit. (e.x. if `count` == 6,000 and `limit` == 5000, counter will display "5,000+")

parameters.name: hide_if_zero
parameters.description: If true, a `hidden` attribute is added to the counter if `count` is zero.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text to display instead of count.

parameters.name: round
parameters.description: Whether to apply our standard rounding logic to value.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: overlay
parameters.description: Dictates the type of overlay to render with. One of `:dark`, `:default`, or `:none`.

parameters.name: reset
parameters.description: Defaults to false. If set to true, it will remove the default caret and remove style from the summary element

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: full
parameters.description: Whether the component should take up the full width of the screen.

parameters.name: spacious
parameters.description: Whether to add margin to the bottom of the component.

parameters.name: dismissible
parameters.description: Whether the component can be dismissed with an X button.

parameters.name: icon
parameters.description: Name of Octicon icon to use.

parameters.name: scheme
parameters.description: One of `:danger`, `:default`, `:success`, or `:warning`.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: icon
parameters.description: Name of [Octicon](https://primer.style/octicons/) to use.

parameters.name: wrapper_arguments
parameters.description: Optional keyword arguments to be passed to the wrapper `<div>` tag.

parameters.name: scheme
parameters.description: One of `:danger`, `:default`, or `:invisible`.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: One of `:large`, `:medium`, or `:small`.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: One of `:a`, `:button`, or `:summary`.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: One of `:button`, `:reset`, or `:submit`.

parameters.name: aria-label
parameters.description: String that can be read by assistive technology. A label should be short and concise. See the accessibility section for more information.

parameters.name: aria-description
parameters.description: String that can be read by assistive technology. A description can be longer as it is intended to provide more context and information. See the accessibility section for more information.

parameters.name: show_tooltip
parameters.description: Whether or not to show a tooltip when this button is hovered. Tooltips should only be hidden if the aria label is redundant, i.e. if the icon has a widely understood definition.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: One of `:a`, `:div`, `:span`, or `:summary`.

parameters.name: scheme
parameters.description: One of `:accent`, `:attention`, `:danger`, `:default`, `:done`, `:info`, `:orange`, `:primary`, `:purple`, `:secondary`, `:severe`, `:sponsors`, `:success`, or `:warning`.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: One of `:large` or `:medium`.

parameters.name: inline
parameters.description: Whether or not to render this label inline.

parameters.name: variant
parameters.description: One of `:inline`, `:large`, or `:none`.

parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.description: One of `:a` or `:span`.

parameters.name: href
parameters.description: URL to be used for the Link. Required if tag is `:a`. If the requirements are not met an error will be raised in non production environments. In production, an empty link element will be rendered.

parameters.name: scheme
parameters.description: One of `:default`, `:primary`, or `:secondary`.

parameters.name: muted
parameters.description: Uses light gray for Link color, and blue on hover.

parameters.name: underline
parameters.description: Whether or not to underline the link.

parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.description: One of `:article`, `:div`, or `:td`.

parameters.name: icon_name
parameters.description: Name of [Octicon](https://primer.style/octicons/) to use.

parameters.description: Name of [Octicon](https://primer.style/octicons/) to use.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: One of `:xsmall` (`12`), `:small` (`16`), or `:medium` (`24`).

parameters.name: use_symbol
parameters.description: EXPERIMENTAL (May change or be removed) - Set to true when using with [OcticonSymbols](/components/alpha/octiconsymbols).

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: One of `:default`, `:large`, or `:small`. Increases height.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: datetime
parameters.description: The time to be formatted.

parameters.name: tense
parameters.description: Which tense to use. One of `:auto`, `:future`, or `:past`.

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: What to prefix the relative ime display with.

parameters.name: second
parameters.description: What format seconds should take. One of `nil`, `:numeric`, or `:two_digit`.

parameters.name: minute
parameters.description: What format minues should take. One of `nil`, `:numeric`, or `:two_digit`.

parameters.name: hour
parameters.description: What format hours should take. One of `nil`, `:numeric`, or `:two_digit`.

parameters.name: weekday
parameters.description: What format weekdays should take. One of `nil`, `:long`, `:narrow`, or `:short`.

parameters.name: day
parameters.description: What format days should take. One of `nil`, `:numeric`, or `:two_digit`.

parameters.name: month
parameters.description: What format months should take. One of `nil`, `:long`, `:narrow`, `:numeric`, `:short`, or `:two_digit`.

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: What format years should take. One of `nil`, `:numeric`, or `:two_digit`.

parameters.name: time_zone_name
parameters.description: What format the time zone should take. One of `nil`, `:long`, `:long_generic`, `:long_offset`, `:short`, `:short_generic`, or `:short_offset`.

parameters.name: threshold
parameters.description: The threshold, in ISO-8601 'durations' format, at which relative time displays become absolute.

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: The precision elapsed time should display. One of `nil`, `:day`, `:hour`, `:minute`, `:month`, `:second`, or `:year`.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format the display should take. One of `:auto`, `:elapsed`, or `:micro`.

parameters.name: format_style
parameters.description: The format the display should take. One of `nil`, `:long`, `:narrow`, or `:short`.

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: The language to use.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Provide a custom title to the element.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: One of `[:large, 64]`, `[:medium, 32]`, or `[:small, 16]`.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: Custom element styles.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: `title` HTML attribute.

parameters.name: scheme
parameters.description: Background color. One of `:closed`, `:default`, `:green`, `:merged`, `:open`, `:purple`, or `:red`.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: HTML tag for element. One of `:div` or `:span`.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: One of `:default` or `:small`.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: spacious
parameters.description: Whether to add spacing to the Subhead.

parameters.name: hide_border
parameters.description: Whether to hide the border under the heading.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: condensed
parameters.description: Reduce the vertical padding and remove the background from the badge item. Most commonly used in commits.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Text that appears in a larger bold font.

parameters.name: title_tag
parameters.description: HTML tag to use for title.

parameters.name: icon
parameters.description: Octicon icon to use at top of component.

parameters.name: icon_size
parameters.description: One of `:xsmall` (`12`), `:small` (`16`), or `:medium` (`24`).

parameters.name: image_src
parameters.description: Image to display.

parameters.name: image_alt
parameters.description: Alt text for image.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Text that appears below the title. Typically a whole sentence.

parameters.name: button_text
parameters.description: The text of the button.

parameters.name: button_url
parameters.description: The URL where the user will be taken after clicking the button.

parameters.name: button_classes
parameters.description: Classes to apply to action button

parameters.name: link_text
parameters.description: The text of the link.

parameters.name: link_url
parameters.description: The URL where the user will be taken after clicking the link.

parameters.name: narrow
parameters.description: Adds a maximum width.

parameters.name: large
parameters.description: Increases the font size.

parameters.name: spacious
parameters.description: Adds extra padding.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: scheme
parameters.description: One of `:danger`, `:default`, `:invisible`, `:link`, `:outline`, or `:primary`.

parameters.name: variant
parameters.description: DEPRECATED. One of `:medium` or `:small`.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: One of `:medium` or `:small`.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: One of `:a`, `:button`, or `:summary`.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: One of `:button`, `:reset`, or `:submit`.

parameters.name: group_item
parameters.description: Whether button is part of a ButtonGroup.

parameters.name: block
parameters.description: Whether button is full-width with `display: block`.

parameters.name: dropdown
parameters.description: Whether or not to render a dropdown caret.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: scheme
parameters.description: One of `:danger` or `:default`.

parameters.name: icon
parameters.description: Name of [Octicon](https://primer.style/octicons/) to use.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: One of `:a`, `:button`, or `:summary`.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: One of `:button`, `:reset`, or `:submit`.

parameters.name: aria-label
parameters.description: String that can be read by assistive technology. A label should be short and concise. See the accessibility section for more information.

parameters.name: aria-description
parameters.description: String that can be read by assistive technology. A description can be longer as it is intended to provide more context and information. See the accessibility section for more information.

parameters.name: box
parameters.description: Whether the button is in a [BorderBox](/components/beta/borderbox). If `true`, the button will have the `Box-btn-octicon` class.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: responsive
parameters.description: Whether to collapse layout to a single column at smaller widths.

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: Which side to display the sidebar on. One of `:left` or `:right`.

parameters.name: sidebar_col
parameters.description: Sidebar column width.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: list
parameters.description: Whether the Tab is an item in a `<ul>` list.

parameters.name: selected
parameters.description: Whether the Tab is selected or not.

parameters.name: with_panel
parameters.description: Whether the Tab has an associated panel.

parameters.name: panel_id
parameters.description: Only applies if `with_panel` is `true`. Unique id of panel.

parameters.name: icon_classes
parameters.description: Classes that must always be applied to icons.

parameters.name: wrapper_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments) to be used in the `<li>` wrapper when the tab is an item in a list.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: the text to appear in the tooltip

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Direction of the tooltip. One of `:e`, `:n`, `:ne`, `:nw`, `:s`, `:se`, `:sw`, or `:w`.

parameters.name: align
parameters.description: Align tooltips to the left or right of an element, combined with a `direction` to specify north or south. One of `:default`, `:left_1`, `:left_2`, `:right_1`, or `:right_2`.

parameters.name: multiline
parameters.description: Use this when you have long content

parameters.name: no_delay
parameters.description: By default the tooltips have a slight delay before appearing. Set true to override this

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: One of `:div`, `:p`, `:span`, or `:strong`.

parameters.name: inline
parameters.description: Whether the element is inline (or inline-block).

parameters.name: expandable
parameters.description: Whether the entire string should be revealed on hover. Can only be used in conjunction with `inline`.

parameters.name: max_width
parameters.description: Sets the max-width of the text.

parameters.name: system_arguments
parameters.description: [System arguments](/system-arguments)
